## Cheatsheets

* [R and RStudio-related cheatsheets](https://posit.co/resources/cheatsheets/).

## Tutorials, manuals and books

* _[R for Data Science](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/)_, excellent free online book by Hadley Wickham, Mine Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel, and Garrett Grolemund
* Two introductory materials to R by The Carpentries: [R for Reproducible Scientific Analysis](https://swcarpentry.github.io/r-novice-gapminder/) and [Data Analysis and Visualization in R for Ecologists](https://datacarpentry.github.io/R-ecology-lesson/)
* Why use R over Excel for your analyses? This post provides arguments and a short introduction to R: _[Excel vs R: A Brief Introduction to R](https://www.jessesadler.com/post/excel-vs-r/)
* _[RStudio Education](https://education.rstudio.com/)_ lists useful resources
* CRAN's [basic and advanced manuals](https://cran.r-project.org/manuals.html)
* Lots of quality tutorials on [STHDA](http://www.sthda.com/english/)
* DataCamp's R [documentation](https://www.datacamp.com/doc/r/category/r-documentation)
* Lots of quality tutorials on _[Cookbook for R](http://www.cookbook-r.com/)_
* [LinkedIn Learning R courses](https://www.linkedin.com/learning/topics/r) (use your UQ credentials)
* Many excellent books on [Bookdown.org](https://bookdown.org/)
* Various [tutorials by LADAL](https://ladal.edu.au/tutorials.html), many focused on language analysis

## Practice

* Solve challenges and learn from other people's solutions on [Exercism](https://exercism.org/tracks/r)
* [{swirl}](https://swirlstats.com/) is a package that allows you to learn R interactively in an R session
* The [{learnr}]{https://rstudio.github.io/learnr/} package integrates into RStudio's "Tutorial" tab

### Data visualisation

* _[The R Graph Gallery](https://www.r-graph-gallery.com/)_ for categorised examples and code
* _[Interactive web-based data visualization with R, plotly, and shiny](https://plotly-r.com/)_, free online book by Carson Sievert

## Questions and answers

* [Questions about R programming](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/r) on StackOverflow
* [Statistics questions using R](https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/tagged/r) on CrossValidated

## Documentation

* Packages from CRAN and Bioconductor on [Rdocumentation](http://www.rdocumentation.org/)
* Packages from CRAN, Bioconductor, R-Forge and GitHub (and run R code online) on [rdrr.io](https://rdrr.io/)

## R news

* Daily news and tutorials on [R-bloggers](https://www.r-bloggers.com/)
* Weekly digest of R news on [R Weekly](https://rweekly.org/)
* [Tidyverse (and Tidymodels) news](https://tidyverse.org/blog/)

## At UQ

* See the [next sessions](https://web.library.uq.edu.au/study-and-learning-support/training-and-workshops/online-and-person-workshops) at the Library
* Join the monthly [UQ R User Group](https://uqrug.netlify.app/) (UQRUG) to collaborate and share with other R users
* Ask questions to other researchers during the weekly [Hacky Hour](https://rcc.uq.edu.au/training-support/meetups)
* Contact your unit's statistician
